channel.title: W3C Devices and Sensors Working Group-relevant MDN issues
channel.description: Issue filed on MDN Web Docs related to pages attached to technologies developed by W3C Devices and Sensors Working Group

item.title: [orientation-event, compat] Content bug: Improve device/screen orientation event doc
item.content:encoded:
What page(s) did you find the problem on?

A number of docs related to device orientation

Orientation and motion data explained

  • Still marked as draft
  • Does not cover DeviceMotion frame.
  • Explains only the absolute frame, not the relative frame.

Web APIs > Detecting device orientation

  • needs better linking to above doc.

  • Window.ondeviceorientationabsolute - corresponding docs missing. Looks like this is absolute-only version of orientation relative to earth frame, based on compass.

  • Window.deviceorientation_event and Window.ondeviceorientation

    • Marked experimental, but looks like the main API
    • Documented as relative to earth frame, but has absolute and relative value. Various docs indicate it is not standardised and some systems do relative, some absolute. Not clear what relative "means". So basically need to find out what relative means and what systems support what behaviour.

  • Window.orientationchange (also the event). This is the angle relative to the natural device orientation of the screen. So relative to the deviceorientation.

    • Marked as deprecated, but not clear what should be used?
    • There is also Screen.onorientationchange that is also deprecated and FF only.

  • CSS Object Model (CSSOM) > Managing screen orientation - this looks OK but refers to deprecated Screen.onorientationchange

Other relevant docs:

  • Window.devicemotion_event (and friends)
  • Google doc on topic
    Anyway,
  • Chrome 50 info on change that confuses me
  • Pretty cool tute
